I am a self-funded glaciologist working to improve sea level rise estimates, specifically by considering the melt reducing effect of rock debris on glaciers. Rock debris has been a long outstanding omission from global glacier models and my work is focused on resolving this knowledge gap. Beginning in 2009, I established a field research program measuring rock debris on glaciers in the Alaska Range which was, and remains, largely uninvestigated by previous scientists.
